Reverend A. J. Peterman, S.J.
Professor of Speech and Sacred Eloquence
West Baden College
West Baden Springs, Indiana
Dear Reverend Petermans
In answer to your letter of November 24, we would like to give you infor¬
mation regarding membership in the National Association of Educational
Broadcasters.
The NAEB has categories of membership as follows:
Active - Educational institutions, public service organizations, etc.
owning and operating their own radio and/or TV stations.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
production centers and regularly producing programs over
a commercial outlet.
Affiliate - Organizations interested in the general furtherance 0f
educational broadcasting.
Individual - All persons interested in or seeking to promote educa¬
tional, cultural and public service broadcasting.
For Active members with radio and/or TV stations, dues in the Association
are based on rated transmitter power as follows:

Class A
(5kv and over)
$100.00

Class A

Class B

Combinations (multiple transmitters)
Amr member operating more than one station (radio and/or
TV) shall pay dues equal to the sum of the dues for each
of the stations, but in no case over $200.00
